title.narrative: 2. ACCESS TO INCLUSIVE BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: 2. By 2018, increased government and non-government capacities to provide access to inclusive basic education particularly amongst indigenous minorities and children with disabilities including in emergencies., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2018, boys and girls in Cambodia have more equitable access to and completion of quality inclusive education with improved learning outcomes.

title.narrative: 2. By 2018, increased government and non-government capacities to provide access to inclusive basic education particularly amongstindigenous minorities and children with disabilities including in emergencies.

description.narrative: A key finding from the Multilingual Education valuation is that the programme greatly expanded access to education for children from indigenous groups. UNICEF&39;s support to scholarships for indigenous students (grades 11 and 12) reached 1,095 students (546 female). | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:17/01/2019

title.narrative: Overall percentage change in the number of children enrolled in multilingual primary schools in the 5 North Eastern provinces
